snippet: Even as 2011 was a year of stable prices and steady sales in Manhattan real estate, it may go down in history as a banner year for co-op and condo board vetoes.
abstract: 2011 was a year of stable prices and steady sales in Manhattan real estate, but it may still go down in history as a banner year for co-op and condo board vetoes as real estate brokers, lawyers and property managers all say boards significantly stepped up their financial scrutiny of prospective buyers.
lead_paragraph: Even as 2011 was a year of stable prices and steady sales in Manhattan real estate, it may go down in history as a banner year for co-op and condo board vetoes.
